snippet: Years of fighting were supposed to end when South Sudan won its independence from Sudan last July, but instead both countries are once again mobilizing for war.
abstract: South Sudan, which had hoped that years of conflict had ended when it became independent from the north in July 2011, appears to be mobilizing for war as clashes over an oil-rich border with Sudan escalate; citizens throughout South Sudan are donating whatever they can--money, food, combatants--to the military effort.

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Khartoum, Sudan.

lead_paragraph: Years of fighting were supposed to end when South Sudan won its independence from Sudan last July, but instead both countries are once again mobilizing for war.

headline.seo: Two Sudans Brace for a War Both Thought Was Over
headline.main: In 2 Sudans, Familiarity With Path to War
headline.print_headline: In 2 Sudans, Familiarity With Path To War
